intro: Liabum tenuius, commonly known as the slender liabum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
